results.title: The First World Karate-Do Championship tournament
results.brief_description: Footage of the “First world karate-do Championships Tournament”, including opening ceremony and demonstrations. Presumably held in Japan, c. 1960. Competing countries include: Thailand, Indonesia, States of Brunei, USA, Great Britain, Korea, Canada, Chile, Hon Kong, Israel, Malaysia, Mexico, New Zealand, and many others. 1st, 2nd and 3rd places won by Japan.

results.title: The First Wave
results.creator_credit: Liz Burke Films, Liz Burke, Thomas Parkinson and Pip Starr
results.brief_description:
The people of the Carteret Islands are about to make history. They will soon begin abandoning their small chain of islands, as rising seas make them increasingly uninhabitable. These islands are a group of coral atolls, just north of Papua New Guinea. The people will be re-locating to Bougainville, which is a move fraught with cultural and political problems. They will be the first people in the world to make such a move, but they will not be the last.

In ‘The First Wave’ we meet the Islanders for the first time and see their island home. We experience their traditional life-style and hear their hopes and fears for the future. There are differing opinions amongst the Islanders about what they want but their fear is that no-one is listening.

results.title: The First signs of Washoe
results.brief_description: This film focuses on Washoe, a chimpanzee who from the age of ten months was taught to express herself using American sign language. Also looks at another chimp, Lana, who can construct sentences in correct order to achieve simple computer commands. This film also raises questions concerning the nature/nurture issue.

results.title: The First priority
results.creator_credit: United Nations Television, National Educational Television, Joe O'Brien and Ray Davey
results.brief_description: A comprehensive summary of the world food problem indicating why it is such a crucial problem today. Shows how the FAO is already coping with the problem and how the campaign is aimed at showing people all over the world what can be done. Gives examples of action projects aimed at long term solutions.

results.title: The First pollution
results.brief_description: Reports on current efforts to clean up soources of water supply in America and potential solutions to the problem of water pollution. Comparative footage of two major rivers shows the results of an expanding program of waste treatment. Illustrates industry’s role in controlling and reducing pollution hazards. Visits the waste treatment plant at Lake Tahoe.

results.title: The First moving picture show
results.brief_description: A short claymation piece giving a unique perspective on early cinema. Plasticine models and simple drawings are combined with limited dialogue to show how pictures were made to move.

results.title: The First motion picture show
results.brief_description: Excellent combination of artwork, old still photos, and animation illustrates the successive stages leading to the first successful public motion-picture demonstration in 1880. Traces the technological development of the three essential components of the motion picture: projection, animation and photography.

results.title: The First mile up
results.brief_description: A film on air pollution, with surprising disclosures of what the seemingly empty air around us holds. The film noses around the atmosphere that encloses our Earth - the comparatively thin envelope of air on which all life depends. The problem is discussed by engineers, health authorities and scientists, including Nobel-prize-winning chemist Dr. Linus Pauling.

results.title: The First five minutes
results.brief_description: Illustrates the fact that the first five minutes are the most important in fighting fires. Shows the best methods to be used in preventing and extinguishing fires by brigades organised in industries as well as municipal brigades.

results.title: The First fifty years: Kenya and Tanganyika
results.creator_credit: Mercury Film Productions and Sylvia Story
results.brief_description: The development of the grain milling industry in Kenya and Tanganyika. The major part of the film deals with the work of UNGA, a large scale wheat growing and marketing organisation in Kenya, with other sequences giving a general picture of progress in the agricultural industry, underlining the contribution of modern plant, qualified technicians, research and advisory services.
